page.title: 10FARMING IN THE WEDMORE AREA
page.content: In the area many houses bear farm titles but they are no longer working farms. Of the 17 major farms remaining most have between 50 and 200 acres with a few around 300 acres. The holdings consist of a large part of the land around the house and some (often rented) on the flat moorland. The farms are mainly dairy of predominately Freisian herds with a ratio of one acre per head of cattle. Most farms rear a small percentage of beef cattle (Herefords) and some also have a few sheep. The cattle are fed in the winter on silage, hay and concentrates and on grass from April until October.1/3 of the farmers use Artificial Insemination for their cows while 2/3 use A.I. in conjunction with a bull (usually a Hereford). There are a number of small holdings one of which has 17 goats.
